candidate of economic sciences bachinina yulia petrovna abstract the study examines the challenges of oil and gas company ’ s stakeholder management practices in the process of execution of major project in iraq the distinctive traits of stakeholders in regional markets and the peculiarities of their management were identified identification of stakeholder management regional characteristics would benefit the quality of major projects ’ implementation and reduce the risks associated with ineffective project execution keywords stakeholder management project management foreign projects middle east the paper examines the challenges of stakeholder management faced by an oil and gas company in the process of project implementation in iraq the topic relevance could be attributed to the importance of major oil and gas projects in the context of growing cooperation between russia and middle eastern countries the major projects in the middle east have a strategic significance for russian oil and gas companies in conditions of fluctuation geopolitical environment and severe economic instability in the light of political discrepancies between russia and the west the formation of enduring connections between russia and the middle eastern countries becomes one of the central topics on today ’ s agenda the importance of strategic partnership with the middle east is recognized both by the government and private business according to expert opinions and government evaluations the volume of cooperation initiatives with the middle eastern partners is expected to grow in the following years iraq has proven to be an important regional partner for russia with several major projects being implemented and billions of dollars invested in iraqi oil and gas sector over the last years it could be stated that expanding russian presence in iraqi energy market and cooperation with local companies in terms of project execution would yield significant economic benefits thereby the question of building stable relationships with regional government and businesses becomes increasingly significant in the context of project management stakeholder management ’ s main steps include the identification of stakeholders analyzing their needs and expectations measuring the level of their influence on the project and outlining the effective strategy of mutual communications it has been proven in academic literature that insufficient efforts in terms of stakeholder management often account for significant economic losses and project failures thus identifying main stakeholders and their needs is argued to be one of the main steps in the process of project planning the study examines the distinctive traits of external stakeholders загрязнять подводный источник abstract the as manager this network is most favorable when there is a potential conflict of interest in the region where pipelines are laid the interconnector model is characterized by the fact that passing through different national legal regimes the pipeline belongs to a different legal system thus the backbone network connects with different states 640 in the international law relating to the energy various configurations including pipelines pumps valves and safety valves the application is based on mathematical modeling of wave processes that occur in pipelines when the nature of the existing equipment changes to solve this problem a system of equations describing the unsteady flow of liquid in the pipeline was taken as a basis when modeling equipment in the cross section of which there is a pressure difference at opposite ends some additional condition is required depending on the device the theoretical foundations and functionality of the software package are described examples of its defects from existing regulatory documents for field pipelines as a result of the analysis of the methods considered in the work it was concluded that they are based on a comparison of the longitudinal and circumferential distances between corrosion defects with the corresponding limiting values the studies were carried out on the basis of numerical simulation of stresses in the zone of pipeline defects using the finite element analysis method the distance at which the defects begin to interact with each other was determined and compared with the considered limiting values of the methods from the literature ключевой слово трубопровод коррозионный дефект критерий взаимодействие key words pipeline corrosion defect interaction criterion продолжительный эксплуатация трубопровод
